abstract:
In a previous joint article with F. Abu Salem, we gave efficient algorithms
for Jacobian group arithmetic of "typical" divisor classes on C_{3,4} curves,
following the lead of other authors. At the time, we could only state that a
generic divisor is typical, and hence unlikely to be encountered if one
implements these algorithms over a very large finite field. This article pins
down an explicit sufficient characterization of these typical divisors, and
proves that if the algorithms in our previous article can be carried out, then
this provides a guarantee that the resulting output is correct and that the
resulting divisor is also typical. The results in this article extend to
arbitrary curves having at least one rational point, hence in particular to all
C_{a,b} curves. As a byproduct of our work, we obtain a further speedup of
approximately 15% on our earlier algorithms for C_{3,4} curves.
